items.title: Awesome Go Updates on Mar 14 - Mar 20, 2022
items.summary: 79 awesome projects updated on Mar 14 - Mar 20, 2022
items.content_text:
### Language Detection

*   [guesslanguage (⭐58)](https://github.com/endeveit/guesslanguage) - Functions to determine the natural language of a unicode text.
*   [whatlanggo (⭐659)](https://github.com/abadojack/whatlanggo) - Natural language detection package for Go. Supports 84 languages and 24 scripts (writing systems e.g. Latin, Cyrillic, etc).

### Morphological Analyzers

*   [snowball (⭐38)](https://github.com/goodsign/snowball) - Snowball stemmer port (cgo wrapper) for Go. Provides word stem extraction functionality [Snowball native](http://snowball.tartarus.org/).
*   [spaGO (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/nlpodyssey/spago) - Self-contained Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing library in Go.

### Slugifiers

*   [go-slugify (⭐95)](https://github.com/mozillazg/go-slugify) - Make pretty slug with multiple languages support.
*   [slug (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/gosimple/slug) - URL-friendly slugify with multiple languages support.
*   [Slugify (⭐34)](https://github.com/avelino/slugify) - Go slugify application that handles string.

### Tokenizers

*   [gojieba (⭐2.5k)](https://github.com/yanyiwu/gojieba) - This is a Go implementation of [jieba (⭐34k)](https://github.com/fxsjy/jieba) which a Chinese word splitting algorithm.
*   [gotokenizer (⭐21)](https://github.com/xujiajun/gotokenizer) - A tokenizer based on the dictionary and Bigram language models for Golang. (Now only support chinese segmentation)
*   [gse (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/go-ego/gse) - Go efficient text segmentation; support english, chinese, japanese and other.
*   [MMSEGO (⭐62)](https://github.com/awsong/MMSEGO) - This is a GO implementation of [MMSEG](http://technology.chtsai.org/mmseg/) which a Chinese word splitting algorithm.
*   [prose (⭐3.1k)](https://github.com/jdkato/prose) - Library for text processing that supports tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity extraction, and more. English only.

### Translation

*   [go-i18n (⭐3.3k)](https://github.com/nicksnyder/go-i18n/) - Package and an accompanying tool to work with localized text.
*   [go-mystem (⭐34)](https://github.com/dveselov/mystem) - CGo bindings to Yandex.Mystem - russian morphology analyzer.
*   [go-pinyin (⭐1.7k)](https://github.com/mozillazg/go-pinyin) - CN Hanzi to Hanyu Pinyin converter.
*   [gotext (⭐473)](https://github.com/leonelquinteros/gotext) - GNU gettext utilities for Go.
*   [iuliia-go (⭐53)](https://github.com/mehanizm/iuliia-go) - Transliterate Cyrillic → Latin in every possible way.
*   [t (⭐20)](https://github.com/youthlin/t) - Another i18n pkg for golang, which follows GNU gettext style and supports .po/.mo files: `t.T (gettext)`, `t.N (ngettext)`, etc. And it contains a cmd tool [xtemplate (⭐20)](https://github.com/youthlin/t/blob/main/cmd/xtemplate), which can extract messages as a pot file from text/html template.

### Transliteration

*   [enca (⭐18)](https://github.com/endeveit/enca) - Minimal cgo bindings for [libenca](https://cihar.com/software/enca/), which detects character encodings.
*   [go-unidecode (⭐141)](https://github.com/mozillazg/go-unidecode) - ASCII transliterations of Unicode text.
*   [gounidecode (⭐80)](https://github.com/fiam/gounidecode) - Unicode transliterator (also known as unidecode) for Go.

### Networking

*   [gldap (⭐115)](https://github.com/jimlambrt/gldap) - gldap provides an ldap server implementation and you provide handlers for its ldap operations.

### Formatters

*   [address (⭐77)](https://github.com/bojanz/address) - Handles address representation, validation and formatting.
*   [align (⭐84)](https://github.com/Guitarbum722/align) - A general purpose application that aligns text.
*   [bytes (⭐553)](https://github.com/labstack/gommon/tree/master/bytes) - Formats and parses numeric byte values (10K, 2M, 3G, etc.).
*   [go-fixedwidth (⭐86)](https://github.com/ianlopshire/go-fixedwidth) - Fixed-width text formatting (encoder/decoder with reflection).
*   [go-humanize (⭐4.6k)](https://github.com/dustin/go-humanize) - Formatters for time, numbers, and memory size to human readable format.
*   [gotabulate (⭐337)](https://github.com/bndr/gotabulate) - Easily pretty-print your tabular data with Go.
*   [textwrap (⭐5)](https://github.com/isbm/textwrap) - Wraps text at end of lines. Implementation of `textwrap` module from Python.

### Markup Languages

*   [bafi (⭐107)](https://github.com/mmalcek/bafi) - Universal JSON, BSON, YAML, XML translator to ANY format using templates.
*   [bbConvert (⭐12)](https://github.com/CalebQ42/bbConvert) - Converts bbCode to HTML that allows you to add support for custom bbCode tags.
*   [blackfriday (⭐5.6k)](https://github.com/russross/blackfriday) - Markdown processor in Go.
*   [go-output-format (⭐18)](https://github.com/drewstinnett/go-output-format) - Output go structures into multiple formats (YAML/JSON/etc) in your command line app.
*   [go-toml (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/pelletier/go-toml) - Go library for the TOML format with query support and handy cli tools.
*   [html-to-markdown (⭐2.9k)](https://github.com/JohannesKaufmann/html-to-markdown) - Convert HTML to Markdown. Even works with entire websites and can be extended through rules.
*   [htmlquery (⭐769)](https://github.com/antchfx/htmlquery) - An XPath query package for HTML, lets you extract data or evaluate from HTML documents by an XPath expression.
*   [mxj (⭐627)](https://github.com/clbanning/mxj) - Encode / decode XML as JSON or map\[string]interface{}; extract values with dot-notation paths and wildcards. Replaces x2j and j2x packages.
*   [toml (⭐4.8k)](https://github.com/BurntSushi/toml) - TOML configuration format (encoder/decoder with reflection).

### Parsers/Encoders/Decoders

*   [allot (⭐59)](https://github.com/sbstjn/allot) - Placeholder and wildcard text parsing for CLI tools and bots.
*   [codetree (⭐25)](https://github.com/aerogo/codetree) - Parses indented code (python, pixy, scarlet, etc.) and returns a tree structure.
*   [commonregex (⭐900)](https://github.com/mingrammer/commonregex) - A collection of common regular expressions for Go.
*   [did (⭐93)](https://github.com/ockam-network/did) - DID (Decentralized Identifiers) Parser and Stringer in Go.
*   [doi (⭐11)](https://github.com/hscells/doi) - Document object identifier (doi) parser in Go.
*   [editorconfig-core-go (⭐147)](https://github.com/editorconfig/editorconfig-core-go) - Editorconfig file parser and manipulator for Go.
*   [go-nmea (⭐244)](https://github.com/adrianmo/go-nmea) - NMEA parser library for the Go language.
*   [go-vcard (⭐118)](https://github.com/emersion/go-vcard) - Parse and format vCard.
*   [gofeed (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/mmcdole/gofeed) - Parse RSS and Atom feeds in Go.
*   [gographviz (⭐564)](https://github.com/awalterschulze/gographviz) - Parses the Graphviz DOT language.
*   [gonameparts (⭐43)](https://github.com/polera/gonameparts) - Parses human names into individual name parts.
*   [ltsv (⭐9)](https://github.com/Wing924/ltsv) - High performance [LTSV (Labeled Tab Separated Value)](http://ltsv.org/) reader for Go.
*   [normalize (⭐52)](https://github.com/avito-tech/normalize) - Sanitize, normalize and compare fuzzy text.
*   [parseargs-go (⭐10)](https://github.com/nproc/parseargs-go) - string argument parser that understands quotes and backslashes.
*   [parth (⭐0)](https://github.com/codemodus/parth) - URL path segmentation parsing.
*   [sdp (⭐113)](https://github.com/gortc/sdp) - SDP: Session Description Protocol \[[RFC 4566](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4566)].
*   [sh (⭐7.8k)](https://github.com/mvdan/sh) - Shell parser and formatter.
*   [when (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/olebedev/when) - Natural EN and RU language date/time parser with pluggable rules.
*   [xj2go (⭐36)](https://github.com/stackerzzq/xj2go) - Convert xml or json to go struct.

### Regular Expressions

*   [genex (⭐76)](https://github.com/alixaxel/genex) - Count and expand Regular Expressions into all matching Strings.
*   [go-wildcard (⭐87)](https://github.com/IGLOU-EU/go-wildcard) - Simple and lightweight wildcard pattern matching.
*   [goregen (⭐92)](https://github.com/zach-klippenstein/goregen) - Library for generating random strings from regular expressions.
*   [regroup (⭐147)](https://github.com/oriser/regroup) - Match regex expression named groups into go struct using struct tags and automatic parsing.

### Sanitation

*   [bluemonday (⭐3.4k)](https://github.com/microcosm-cc/bluemonday) - HTML Sanitizer.
*   [gofuckyourself (⭐69)](https://github.com/JoshuaDoes/gofuckyourself) - A sanitization-based swear filter for Go.

### Scrapers

*   [colly (⭐24k)](https://github.com/asciimoo/colly) - Fast and Elegant Scraping Framework for Gophers.
*   [dataflowkit (⭐688)](https://github.com/slotix/dataflowkit) - Web scraping Framework to turn websites into structured data.
*   [GoQuery (⭐15k)](https://github.com/PuerkitoBio/goquery) - GoQuery brings a syntax and a set of features similar to jQuery to the Go language.
*   [pagser (⭐108)](https://github.com/foolin/pagser) - Pagser is a simple, extensible, configurable parse and deserialize html page to struct based on goquery and struct tags for golang crawler.
*   [Tagify (⭐39)](https://github.com/zoomio/tagify) - Produces a set of tags from given source.
*   [xurls (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/mvdan/xurls) - Extract urls from text.

### RSS

*   [podcast (⭐136)](https://github.com/eduncan911/podcast) - iTunes Compliant and RSS 2.0 Podcast Generator in Golang

### Utility/Miscellaneous

*   [go-runewidth (⭐643)](https://github.com/mattn/go-runewidth) - Functions to get fixed width of the character or string.
*   [go-zero-width (⭐110)](https://github.com/trubitsyn/go-zero-width) - Zero-width character detection and removal for Go.
*   [kace (⭐20)](https://github.com/codemodus/kace) - Common case conversions covering common initialisms.
*   [petrovich (⭐50)](https://github.com/striker2000/petrovich) - Petrovich is the library which inflects Russian names to given grammatical case.
*   [radix (⭐193)](https://github.com/yourbasic/radix) - Fast string sorting algorithm.
*   [TySug (⭐19)](https://github.com/Dynom/TySug) - Alternative suggestions with respect to keyboard layouts.

### Validation

*   [Validator (⭐7)](https://github.com/go-the-way/validator) - A lightweight model validator written in Go.Contains VFs:Min, Max, MinLength, MaxLength, Length, Enum, Regex.

### DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [Mantil (⭐112)](https://github.com/mantil-io/mantil) - Go specific framework for building serverless applications on AWS that enables you to focus on pure Go code while Mantil takes care of the infrastructure.

### E-books for purchase / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [Know Go: Generics](https://bitfieldconsulting.com/books/generics) - A guide to understanding and using generics in Go.

items.title: Awesome Go Updates on Feb 28 - Mar 06, 2022

items.content_text:
### Database Schema Migration

*   [godfish (⭐8)](https://github.com/rafaelespinoza/godfish) - Database migration manager, works with native query language. Support for cassandra, mysql, postgres, sqlite3.

### Email

*   [truemail-go (⭐120)](https://github.com/truemail-rb/truemail-go) - Configurable Golang email validator/verifier. Verify email via Regex, DNS, SMTP and even more.

### Utilities

*   [lo (⭐20k)](https://github.com/samber/lo) - A Lodash like Go library based on Go 1.18+ Generics (map, filter, contains, find...)

### Web Frameworks

*   [Beego (⭐32k)](https://github.com/beego/beego) - beego is an open-source, high-performance web framework for the Go programming language.
*   [Huma (⭐3.2k)](https://github.com/danielgtaylor/huma/) - Framework for modern REST/GraphQL APIs with built-in OpenAPI 3, generated documentation, and a CLI.
items.content_html:
Database Schema Migration

  • godfish (⭐8) - Database migration manager, works with native query language. Support for cassandra, mysql, postgres, sqlite3.

Email

  • truemail-go (⭐120) - Configurable Golang email validator/verifier. Verify email via Regex, DNS, SMTP and even more.

Utilities

  • lo (⭐20k) - A Lodash like Go library based on Go 1.18+ Generics (map, filter, contains, find...)

Web Frameworks

  • Beego (⭐32k) - beego is an open-source, high-performance web framework for the Go programming language.
  • Huma (⭐3.2k) - Framework for modern REST/GraphQL APIs with built-in OpenAPI 3, generated documentation, and a CLI.

items.title: Awesome Go Updates on Feb 21 - Feb 27, 2022
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Feb 21 - Feb 27, 2022
items.content_text:
### Forms

*   [httpin (⭐363)](https://github.com/ggicci/httpin) - Decode an HTTP request into a custom struct, including querystring, forms, HTTP headers, etc.

### HTTP Clients

*   [go-cleanhttp (⭐402)](https://github.com/hashicorp/go-cleanhttp) - Get easily stdlib HTTP client, which does not share any state with other clients.
*   [req (⭐4.5k)](https://github.com/imroc/req) - Simple Go HTTP client with Black Magic (Less code and More efficiency).

### Server Applications

*   [Wish (⭐4.2k)](https://github.com/charmbracelet/wish) - Make SSH apps, just like that!
items.content_html:
Forms

  • req (⭐4.5k) - Simple Go HTTP client with Black Magic (Less code and More efficiency).

Server Applications

items.title: Awesome Go Updates on Feb 14 - Feb 20, 2022
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Feb 14 - Feb 20, 2022
items.content_text:
### Trees

*   [treemap (⭐64)](https://github.com/igrmk/treemap) - Generic key-sorted map using a red-black tree under the hood.

### Email

*   [mailx (⭐19)](https://github.com/valord577/mailx) - Mailx is a library that makes it easier to send email via SMTP. It is an enhancement of the golang standard library `net/smtp`.

### Uncategorized

*   [xz (⭐517)](https://github.com/ulikunitz/xz) - Pure golang package for reading and writing xz-compressed files.

### Other Software / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [stew (⭐276)](https://github.com/marwanhawari/stew) - An independent package manager for compiled binaries.

items.title: Awesome Go Updates on Feb 07 - Feb 13, 2022
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Feb 07 - Feb 13, 2022
items.content_text:
### Project Layout

*   [pagoda (⭐2.6k)](https://github.com/mikestefanello/pagoda) - Rapid, easy full-stack web development starter kit built in Go.

### Template Engines

*   [got (⭐38)](https://github.com/goradd/got) - A Go code generator inspired by Hero and Fasttemplate. Has include files, custom tag definitions, injected Go code, language translation, and more.

### Web Frameworks

*   [Confetti Framework](https://confetti-framework.github.io/docs/) - Confetti is a Go web application framework with an expressive, elegant syntax. Confetti combines the elegance of Laravel and the simplicity of Go.
items.content_html:
Project Layout

  • pagoda (⭐2.6k) - Rapid, easy full-stack web development starter kit built in Go.

Template Engines

  • got (⭐38) - A Go code generator inspired by Hero and Fasttemplate. Has include files, custom tag definitions, injected Go code, language translation, and more.

Web Frameworks

  • Confetti Framework - Confetti is a Go web application framework with an expressive, elegant syntax. Confetti combines the elegance of Laravel and the simplicity of Go.

items.title: Awesome Go Updates on Jan 31 - Feb 06, 2022
items.summary: 1799 awesome projects updated on Jan 31 - Feb 06, 2022
items.content_text:
### Audio and Music

*   [flac (⭐336)](https://github.com/mewkiz/flac) - Native Go FLAC encoder/decoder with support for FLAC streams.
*   [gaad (⭐131)](https://github.com/Comcast/gaad) - Native Go AAC bitstream parser.
*   [GoAudio (⭐377)](https://github.com/DylanMeeus/GoAudio) - Native Go Audio Processing Library.
*   [gosamplerate (⭐36)](https://github.com/dh1tw/gosamplerate) - libsamplerate bindings for go.
*   [id3v2 (⭐348)](https://github.com/bogem/id3v2) - ID3 decoding and encoding library for Go.
*   [malgo (⭐341)](https://github.com/gen2brain/malgo) - Mini audio library.
*   [minimp3 (⭐129)](https://github.com/tosone/minimp3) - Lightweight MP3 decoder library.
*   [Oto (⭐1.7k)](https://github.com/hajimehoshi/oto) - A low-level library to play sound on multiple platforms.
*   [PortAudio (⭐778)](https://github.com/gordonklaus/portaudio) - Go bindings for the PortAudio audio I/O library.

### Authentication and OAuth

*   [branca (⭐90)](https://github.com/essentialkaos/branca) - branca token [specification implementation (⭐230)](https://github.com/tuupola/branca-spec) for Golang 1.15+.
*   [gologin (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/dghubble/gologin) - chainable handlers for login with OAuth1 and OAuth2 authentication providers.
*   [gorbac (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/mikespook/gorbac) - provides a lightweight role-based access control (RBAC) implementation in Golang.
*   [goth (⭐6.1k)](https://github.com/markbates/goth) - provides a simple, clean, and idiomatic way to use OAuth and OAuth2. Handles multiple providers out of the box.
*   [jwt (⭐363)](https://github.com/pascaldekloe/jwt) - Lightweight JSON Web Token (JWT) library.
*   [jwt-auth (⭐234)](https://github.com/adam-hanna/jwt-auth) - JWT middleware for Golang http servers with many configuration options.
*   [osin (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/openshift/osin) - Golang OAuth2 server library.
*   [otpgen (⭐140)](https://github.com/grijul/otpgen) - Library to generate TOTP/HOTP codes.
*   [otpgo (⭐75)](https://github.com/jltorresm/otpgo) - Time-Based One-Time Password (TOTP) and HMAC-Based One-Time Password (HOTP) library for Go.
*   [paseto (⭐900)](https://github.com/o1egl/paseto) - Golang implementation of Platform-Agnostic Security Tokens (PASETO).
*   [scope (⭐41)](https://github.com/SonicRoshan/scope) - Easily Manage OAuth2 Scopes In Go.
*   [scs (⭐2.4k)](https://github.com/alexedwards/scs) - Session Manager for HTTP servers.
*   [securecookie (⭐81)](https://github.com/chmike/securecookie) - Efficient secure cookie encoding/decoding.
*   [session (⭐118)](https://github.com/icza/session) - Go session management for web servers (including support for Google App Engine - GAE).
*   [sessions (⭐78)](https://github.com/adam-hanna/sessions) - Dead simple, highly performant, highly customizable sessions service for go http servers.
*   [sessionup (⭐128)](https://github.com/swithek/sessionup) - Simple, yet effective HTTP session management and identification package.
*   [sjwt (⭐123)](https://github.com/brianvoe/sjwt) - Simple jwt generator and parser.

### Blockchain

*   [cosmos-sdk (⭐6.6k)](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk) - A Framework for Building Public Blockchains in the Cosmos Ecosystem.
*   [go-ethereum (⭐49k)](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum) - Official Go implementation of the Ethereum protocol.
*   [gossamer (⭐451)](https://github.com/ChainSafe/gossamer) - A Go implementation of the Polkadot Host.
*   [solana-go (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/gagliardetto/solana-go) - Go library to interface with Solana JSON RPC and WebSocket interfaces.
*   [tendermint (⭐5.8k)](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint) - High-performance middleware for transforming a state machine written in any programming language into a Byzantine Fault Tolerant replicated state machine using the Tendermint consensus and blockchain protocols.

### Bot Building

*   [echotron (⭐405)](https://github.com/NicoNex/echotron) - An elegant and concurrent library for Telegram Bots in Go.
*   [go-joe](https://joe-bot.net) - A general-purpose bot library inspired by Hubot but written in Go.
*   [go-twitch-irc (⭐377)](https://github.com/gempir/go-twitch-irc) - Library to write bots for twitch.tv chat
*   [micha (⭐30)](https://github.com/onrik/micha) - Go Library for Telegram bot api.
*   [slack-bot (⭐198)](https://github.com/innogames/slack-bot) - Ready to use Slack Bot for lazy developers: Custom commands, Jenkins, Jira, Bitbucket, Github...
*   [telego (⭐734)](https://github.com/mymmrac/telego) - Telegram Bot API library for Golang with full one-to-one API implementation.

### Build Automation

*   [1build (⭐233)](https://github.com/gopinath-langote/1build) - Command line tool to frictionlessly manage project-specific commands.
*   [anko (⭐41)](https://github.com/GuilhermeCaruso/anko) - Simple application watcher for multiple programming languages.
*   [gilbert](https://go-gilbert.github.io) - Build system and task runner for Go projects.
*   [goyek (⭐629)](https://github.com/goyek/goyek) - Create build pipelines in Go.
*   [mage (⭐4.4k)](https://github.com/magefile/mage) - Mage is a make/rake-like build tool using Go.
*   [mmake (⭐1.7k)](https://github.com/tj/mmake) - Modern Make.
*   [Task (⭐13k)](https://github.com/go-task/task) - simple "Make" alternative.
*   [taskctl (⭐312)](https://github.com/taskctl/taskctl) - Concurrent task runner.

### Advanced Console UIs

*   [asciigraph (⭐2.8k)](https://github.com/guptarohit/asciigraph) - Go package to make lightweight ASCII line graph ╭┈╯ in command line apps with no other dependencies.
*   [box-cli-maker (⭐565)](https://github.com/Delta456/box-cli-maker) - Make Highly Customized Boxes for your CLI.
*   [cfmt (⭐106)](https://github.com/mingrammer/cfmt) - Contextual fmt inspired by bootstrap color classes.
*   [cfmt (⭐70)](https://github.com/i582/cfmt) - Simple and convenient formatted stylized output fully compatible with fmt library.
*   [chalk (⭐465)](https://github.com/ttacon/chalk) - Intuitive package for prettifying terminal/console output.
*   [ctc (⭐50)](https://github.com/wzshiming/ctc) - The non-invasive cross-platform terminal color library does not need to modify the Print method.
*   [go-ataman (⭐19)](https://github.com/workanator/go-ataman) - Go library for rendering ANSI colored text templates in terminals.
*   [go-colorable (⭐793)](https://github.com/mattn/go-colorable) - Colorable writer for windows.
*   [go-colortext (⭐216)](https://github.com/daviddengcn/go-colortext) - Go library for color output in terminals.
*   [go-isatty (⭐864)](https://github.com/mattn/go-isatty) - isatty for golang.
*   [go-prompt (⭐5.4k)](https://github.com/c-bata/go-prompt) - Library for building a powerful interactive prompt, inspired by [python-prompt-toolkit (⭐9.8k)](https://github.com/jonathanslenders/python-prompt-toolkit).
*   [gocui (⭐10k)](https://github.com/jroimartin/gocui) - Minimalist Go library aimed at creating Console User Interfaces.
*   [gommon/color (⭐553)](https://github.com/labstack/gommon/tree/master/color) - Style terminal text.
*   [gookit/color (⭐1.5k)](https://github.com/gookit/color) - Terminal color rendering tool library, support 16 colors, 256 colors, RGB color rendering output, compatible with Windows.
*   [marker (⭐51)](https://github.com/cyucelen/marker) - Easiest way to match and mark strings for colorful terminal outputs.
*   [mpb (⭐2.4k)](https://github.com/vbauerster/mpb) - Multi progress bar for terminal applications.
*   [progressbar (⭐4.4k)](https://github.com/schollz/progressbar) - Basic thread-safe progress bar that works in every OS.
*   [pterm (⭐5.1k)](https://github.com/pterm/pterm) - A library to beautify console output on every platform with many combinable components.
*   [spinner (⭐2.4k)](https://github.com/briandowns/spinner) - Go package to easily provide a terminal spinner with options.
*   [tabby (⭐358)](https://github.com/cheynewallace/tabby) - A tiny library for super simple Golang tables.
*   [termbox-go (⭐4.7k)](https://github.com/nsf/termbox-go) - Termbox is a library for creating cross-platform text-based interfaces.
*   [termdash (⭐2.8k)](https://github.com/mum4k/termdash) - Go terminal dashboard based on **termbox-go** and inspired by [termui (⭐13k)](https://github.com/gizak/termui).
*   [termenv (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/muesli/termenv) - Advanced ANSI style & color support for your terminal applications.
*   [termui (⭐13k)](https://github.com/gizak/termui) - Go terminal dashboard based on **termbox-go** and inspired by [blessed-contrib (⭐16k)](https://github.com/yaronn/blessed-contrib).
*   [uiprogress (⭐2.1k)](https://github.com/gosuri/uiprogress) - Flexible library to render progress bars in terminal applications.
*   [uitable (⭐741)](https://github.com/gosuri/uitable) - Library to improve readability in terminal apps using tabular data.
*   [yacspin (⭐449)](https://github.com/theckman/yacspin) - Yet Another CLi Spinner package, for working with terminal spinners.

### Standard CLI

*   [argparse (⭐623)](https://github.com/akamensky/argparse) - Command line argument parser inspired by Python's argparse module.
*   [argv (⭐41)](https://github.com/cosiner/argv) - Go library to split command line string as arguments array using the bash syntax.
*   [carapace (⭐736)](https://github.com/rsteube/carapace) - Command argument completion generator for spf13/cobra.
*   [carapace-bin (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/rsteube/carapace-bin) - Multi-shell multi-command argument completer.
*   [climax (⭐219)](https://github.com/tucnak/climax) - Alternative CLI with "human face", in spirit of Go command.
*   [clîr (⭐193)](https://github.com/leaanthony/clir) - A Simple and Clear CLI library. Dependency free.
*   [cmd (⭐43)](https://github.com/posener/cmd) - Extends the standard `flag` package to support sub commands and more in idiomatic way.
*   [cmdr (⭐140)](https://github.com/hedzr/cmdr) - A POSIX/GNU style, getopt-like command-line UI Go library.
*   [cobra (⭐41k)](https://github.com/spf13/cobra) - Commander for modern Go CLI interactions.
*   [commandeer (⭐176)](https://github.com/jaffee/commandeer) - Dev-friendly CLI apps: sets up flags, defaults, and usage based on struct fields and tags.
*   [complete (⭐939)](https://github.com/posener/complete) - Write bash completions in Go + Go command bash completion.
*   [Dnote (⭐2.9k)](https://github.com/dnote/dnote) - A simple command line notebook with multi-device sync.
*   [elvish (⭐6.1k)](https://github.com/elves/elvish) - An expressive programming language and a versatile interactive shell.
*   [env (⭐121)](https://github.com/codingconcepts/env) - Tag-based environment configuration for structs.
*   [flaggy (⭐862)](https://github.com/integrii/flaggy) - A robust and idiomatic flags package with excellent subcommand support.
*   [flagvar (⭐45)](https://github.com/sgreben/flagvar) - A collection of flag argument types for Go's standard `flag` package.
*   [go-arg (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/alexflint/go-arg) - Struct-based argument parsing in Go.
*   [go-flags (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/jessevdk/go-flags) - go command line option parser.
*   [gocmd (⭐66)](https://github.com/devfacet/gocmd) - Go library for building command line applications.
*   [hiboot cli (⭐181)](https://github.com/hidevopsio/hiboot/tree/master/pkg/app/cli) - cli application framework with auto configuration and dependency injection.
*   [job (⭐148)](https://github.com/liujianping/job) - JOB, make your short-term command as a long-term job.
*   [kingpin (⭐3.5k)](https://github.com/alecthomas/kingpin) - Command line and flag parser supporting sub commands (superseded by `kong`; see below).
*   [liner (⭐1.1k)](https://github.com/peterh/liner) - Go readline-like library for command-line interfaces.
*   [mow.cli (⭐886)](https://github.com/jawher/mow.cli) - Go library for building CLI applications with sophisticated flag and argument parsing and validation.
*   [ops (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/nanovms/ops) - Unikernel Builder/Orchestrator.
*   [pflag (⭐2.6k)](https://github.com/spf13/pflag) - Drop-in replacement for Go's flag package, implementing POSIX/GNU-style --flags.
*   [sand (⭐27)](https://github.com/Zaba505/sand) - Simple API for creating interpreters and so much more.
*   [strumt (⭐62)](https://github.com/antham/strumt) - Library to create prompt chain.
*   [subcmd (⭐8)](https://github.com/bobg/subcmd) - Another approach to parsing and running subcommands. Works alongside the standard `flag` package.
*   [ts (⭐21)](https://github.com/liujianping/ts) - Timestamp convert & compare tool.
*   [ukautz/clif (⭐129)](https://github.com/ukautz/clif) - Small command line interface framework.
*   [urfave/cli (⭐23k)](https://github.com/urfave/cli) - Simple, fast, and fun package for building command line apps in Go (formerly codegangsta/cli).
*   [wlog (⭐67)](https://github.com/dixonwille/wlog) - Simple logging interface that supports cross-platform color and concurrency.

### Configuration

*   [aconfig (⭐594)](https://github.com/cristalhq/aconfig) - Simple, useful and opinionated config loader.
*   [cleanenv (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/ilyakaznacheev/cleanenv) - Minimalistic configuration reader (from files, ENV, and wherever you want).
*   [config (⭐337)](https://github.com/JeremyLoy/config) - Cloud native application configuration. Bind ENV to structs in only two lines.
*   [configuration (⭐108)](https://github.com/BoRuDar/configuration) - Library for initializing configuration structs from env variables, files, flags and 'default' tag.
*   [configure (⭐55)](https://github.com/paked/configure) - Provides configuration through multiple sources, including JSON, flags and environment variables.
*   [configuro (⭐94)](https://github.com/sherifabdlnaby/configuro) - opinionated configuration loading & validation framework from ENV and Files focused towards 12-Factor compliant applications.
*   [confita (⭐505)](https://github.com/heetch/confita) - Load configuration in cascade from multiple backends into a struct.
*   [conflate (⭐36)](https://github.com/the4thamigo-uk/conflate) - Library/tool to merge multiple JSON/YAML/TOML files from arbitrary URLs, validation against a JSON schema, and application of default values defined in the schema.
*   [env (⭐5.6k)](https://github.com/caarlos0/env) - Parse environment variables to Go structs (with defaults).
*   [env (⭐70)](https://github.com/junk1tm/env) - A lightweight package for loading environment variables into structs.
*   [envconfig (⭐244)](https://github.com/vrischmann/envconfig) - Read your configuration from environment variables.
*   [envh (⭐100)](https://github.com/antham/envh) - Helpers to manage environment variables.
*   [fig (⭐381)](https://github.com/kkyr/fig) - Tiny library for reading configuration from a file and from environment variables (with validation & defaults).
*   [genv (⭐42)](https://github.com/sakirsensoy/genv) - Read environment variables easily with dotenv support.
*   [go-aws-ssm (⭐62)](https://github.com/PaddleHQ/go-aws-ssm) - Go package that fetches parameters from AWS System Manager - Parameter Store.
*   [go-conf (⭐11)](https://github.com/ThomasObenaus/go-conf) - Simple library for application configuration based on annotated structs. It supports reading the configuration from environment variables, config files and command line parameters.
*   [go-ini (⭐15)](https://github.com/subpop/go-ini) - A Go package that marshals and unmarshals INI-files.
*   [go-ssm-config (⭐22)](https://github.com/ianlopshire/go-ssm-config) - Go utility for loading configuration parameters from AWS SSM (Parameter Store).
*   [go-up (⭐43)](https://github.com/ufoscout/go-up) - A simple configuration library with recursive placeholders resolution and no magic.
*   [godotenv (⭐9.5k)](https://github.com/joho/godotenv) - Go port of Ruby's dotenv library (Loads environment variables from `.env`).
*   [gofigure (⭐68)](https://github.com/ian-kent/gofigure) - Go application configuration made easy.
*   [gonfig (⭐9)](https://github.com/milad-abbasi/gonfig) - Tag-based configuration parser which loads values from different providers into typesafe struct.
*   [gookit/config (⭐558)](https://github.com/gookit/config) - application config manage(load,get,set). support JSON, YAML, TOML, INI, HCL. multi file load, data override merge.
*   [hjson (⭐336)](https://github.com/hjson/hjson-go) - Human JSON, a configuration file format for humans. Relaxed syntax, fewer mistakes, more comments.
*   [hocon (⭐85)](https://github.com/gurkankaymak/hocon) - Configuration library for working with the HOCON(a human-friendly JSON superset) format, supports features like environment variables, referencing other values, comments and multiple files.
*   [ingo (⭐40)](https://github.com/schachmat/ingo) - Flags persisted in an ini-like config file.
*   [ini (⭐3.5k)](https://github.com/go-ini/ini) - Go package to read and write INI files.
*   [joshbetz/config (⭐215)](https://github.com/joshbetz/config) - Small configuration library for Go that parses environment variables, JSON files, and reloads automatically on SIGHUP.
*   [kelseyhightower/envconfig (⭐5.3k)](https://github.com/kelseyhightower/envconfig) - Go library for managing configuration data from environment variables.
*   [koanf (⭐3.3k)](https://github.com/knadh/koanf) - Light weight, extensible library for reading config in Go applications. Built in support for JSON, TOML, YAML, env, command line.
*   [konfig (⭐645)](https://github.com/lalamove/konfig) - Composable, observable and performant config handling for Go for the distributed processing era.
*   [mini (⭐37)](https://github.com/sasbury/mini) - Golang package for parsing ini-style configuration files.
*   [nasermirzaei89/env (⭐18)](https://github.com/nasermirzaei89/env) - Simple useful package for read environment variables.
*   [onion (⭐118)](https://github.com/goraz/onion) - Layer based configuration for Go, Supports JSON, TOML, YAML, properties, etcd, env, and encryption using PGP.
*   [piper (⭐10)](https://github.com/Yiling-J/piper) - Viper wrapper with config inheritance and key generation.
*   [store (⭐275)](https://github.com/tucnak/store) - Lightweight configuration manager for Go.
*   [swap (⭐8)](https://github.com/oblq/swap) - Instantiate/configure structs recursively, based on build environment. (YAML, TOML, JSON and env).
*   [typenv (⭐12)](https://github.com/diegomarangoni/typenv) - Minimalistic, zero dependency, typed environment variables library.
*   [uConfig (⭐72)](https://github.com/omeid/uconfig) - Lightweight, zero-dependency, and extendable configuration management.
*   [viper (⭐29k)](https://github.com/spf13/viper) - Go configuration with fangs.

### Continuous Integration

*   [CDS (⭐4.7k)](https://github.com/ovh/cds) - Enterprise-Grade CI/CD and DevOps Automation Open Source Platform.
*   [drone (⭐33k)](https://github.com/drone/drone) - Drone is a Continuous Integration platform built on Docker, written in Go.
*   [gomason (⭐65)](https://github.com/nikogura/gomason) - Test, Build, Sign, and Publish your go binaries from a clean workspace.

*   [ants (⭐14k)](https://github.com/panjf2000/ants) - A high-performance and low-cost goroutine pool in Go.

### Job Scheduler

*   [clockwerk (⭐181)](https://github.com/onatm/clockwerk) - Go package to schedule periodic jobs using a simple, fluent syntax.

*   [logur (⭐205)](https://github.com/logur/logur) - An opinionated logger interface and collection of logging best practices with adapters and integrations for well-known libraries ([logrus (⭐25k)](https://github.com/sirupsen/logrus), [go-kit log (⭐27k)](https://github.com/go-kit/kit/tree/master/log), [zap (⭐23k)](https://github.com/uber-go/zap), [zerolog (⭐12k)](https://github.com/rs/zerolog), etc).

Audio and Music

  • flac (⭐336) - Native Go FLAC encoder/decoder with support for FLAC streams.
  • gaad (⭐131) - Native Go AAC bitstream parser.
  • GoAudio (⭐377) - Native Go Audio Processing Library.
  • gosamplerate (⭐36) - libsamplerate bindings for go.
  • id3v2 (⭐348) - ID3 decoding and encoding library for Go.
  • malgo (⭐341) - Mini audio library.
  • minimp3 (⭐129) - Lightweight MP3 decoder library.
  • Oto (⭐1.7k) - A low-level library to play sound on multiple platforms.
  • PortAudio (⭐778) - Go bindings for the PortAudio audio I/O library.
